meanings.sent1: The loud noise helped waken the sleeping cat.
meanings.sent2: I waken early every morning to start my day.
meanings.sent3: The alarm clock tried to waken the deep sleeper.
meanings.sent4: The smell of fresh coffee can waken even the sleepiest person.
meanings.sent5: The gentle sunlight streaming through the window wakens me peacefully.

meanings.sent1: She wakens slowly after a long nap.
meanings.sent2: I waken to the sound of birds chirping outside.
meanings.sent3: The smell of bacon cooking wakens my senses.
meanings.sent4: His sudden shout wakens me from my daydream.
meanings.sent5: The loud thunder wakens the entire household in the night.

meanings.definition: To stir or come to life
meanings.sent1: The flowers wakened with the arrival of spring.
meanings.sent2: The forest wakens with the first light of dawn.
meanings.sent3: The old house seemed to waken with each creak and groan.
meanings.sent4: The city wakens to the hustle and bustle of the morning rush.
meanings.sent5: The music seemed to waken memories long forgotten.
